hanzi-su-wiki:
符

Значения

Бирка, талон, билет, знак; удостоверение

Мнемоника

Верительная 付 бамбуковая 竹 бирка, обе половинки которой должны совпадать по линии разреза.
purpleculture_pinyin:
fú
surname Fu; mark; sign; talisman; to seal; to correspond to; tally; symbol; written charm; to coincide
фамилия Фу; отметка; знак; талисман; чтобы запечатать; соответствовать; счет; символ; письменный оберег; совпадать
rtega_mnemonic:
符符RStoken, sign, symbol, mark, tally, charm, match
  • given 付 small 寸 piece of bamboo 竹 with a person's 亻 name on it
  • CJKV. A bamboo 付 slip 寸 on which a contract is written and then broken in two so that the two matching halves can be held by the two parties involved.
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 付 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
符合 [ fú hé ]: in keeping with; in accordance with; tallying with; in line with; to agree with; to accord with; to conform to; to correspond with; to manage; to handle
符号 [ fú hào ]: symbol; mark; sign
不符 [ bù fú ]: inconsistent; not in agreement with; not agree or tally with; not conform to
相符 [ xiāng fú ]: to match; to tally
音符 [ yīn fú ]: (music) note; phonetic component of a Chinese character; phonetic symbol; phonogram
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⺮ [ zhú ] bamboo; flute
    • 付 [ fù ] give, deliver, pay, hand over; entrust
heisig_chinese_memo: Bamboo used to be a symbol of money. Since you could use it to trade for many things, someone with a lot of bamboo had a lot of power to pay for stuff.
heisig_constituent: token, bamboo, adhere, sellotape, person, glue
koohiiStory1: I dropped my token down the drain, so I used a piece of bamboo with chewing gum on the end to retrieve it.
koohiiStory2: At the arcade, Mr. T adheres a bamboo rod to his token so that he can put it in the machine and pull it out repeatedly.
jp_example_words:
符号(ふごう): sign, mark, symbol
切符(きっぷ): ticket
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You take some bamboo and attach it together into a token of appreciation for your friend. Your friend greatly appreciates this token of friendship.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine trying to attach some bamboo together into a token for someone.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You hand over the token but your friend drops it and yells, "You fool (ふ)! I'm allergic to bamboo!"
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the embarrassment you feel, forgetting they were allergic to bamboo. Oh well, it’s the thought that counts. You’re still a fool, though.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 付 (つける、つく、フ прикреплять, придерживаться, передавать).
Ru_trainchinese:
fú: (графема) знак, символ, метка; соответствовать; магические начертания (в древнем Китае заклинания или благословения даосистских монахов)
fú: (сущ) амулет, магические символы (рисуются даосским священником)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you put in place (付) a bamboo (⺮) sign
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Bamboo used to be a symbol of money. Since you could use it to trade for many things, someone with a lot of bamboo had a lot of power to pay for stuff.
humanum_full_description_en:
The character " Fu " was first seen in the bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period, from the bamboo to the sound. It was the voucher used by the ancient imperial court to appoint officials, dispatch troops and dispatch generals.

" Talisman " is generally divided into two halves, the right half is for the emperor, and the left half is for the general. When the troops are deployed, the messenger will bring the talisman to the court before they can act. " Thu " has many shapes, mainly tiger charm ; materials such as copper, wood, jade, etc., mostly bronze.

"Shuowen": "Fu, Xinye. The Chinese system is made of bamboo, which is six inches long, and it is divided and matched. The sound is from the bamboo.

" Fu " is also the proof of entry and exit. "Yu Pian": "Talisman, Talisman Festival. Divided into two sides, each holding one to believe." "Zhou Li": "Talisman Festival at the gate." Generally speaking, " Fu " refers to soldier symbols , and " Jie " refers to pass ; However, " Fu " and " Jie " are both tokens and have the same meaning. The unearthed tiger symbol also has the name " Jie ", see " Jie ".

Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to represent soldiers. For example, Du Hu Fu: "The Talisman of Armament Armament, the right only (in) Jun, and the Left Only (in) Du." "Han Shu. "Wen Emperor Ji": "In the early September, it is a bronze tiger charm and a bamboo messenger charm with the county guard." Ying Shao said: "Bronze tiger charms are the first to fifth. ."

"Mawangdui. After the first volume of Lao Tzu's book, the " inch " line of the word " Fu " is placed on the top, which is the same as the word " inch " in silk script, see " inch ".
humanum_short_description_en: The word " Fu " was first seen in the bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period. It was used to sound from bamboo. It was a voucher used by the ancient imperial court to appoint officials and dispatch troops.
humanum_full_description:
「符」字最早見於戰國金文，從竹付聲，是古代朝廷任官命使、調兵遣將的憑證，也稱兵符。

　　「符」一般分為兩半，右半在帝王，左半在將軍，調兵之時，使者帶符上朝驗合，才可行動。「符」形狀多種，以虎符為主；質料有銅、木、玉等，以青銅為多。

　　《說文》：「符，信也。漢制以竹，長六寸，分而相合。从竹付聲。」

　　「符」又是出入門關的憑證。《玉篇》：「符，符節也。分爲兩邊，各持一以爲信。」《周禮》：「門關用符節。」一般而言，「符」多指兵符，「節」指通行證；不過「符」、「節」同為信物，義同可通，出土虎符亦有自名為「節」者，參見「節」。

　　金文用作本義，表示兵符。如杜虎符：「兵甲之符，右才(在)君，左才(在)杜。」新郪虎符：「甲兵之符，右才(在)王，左才(在)新郪。」《漢書．文帝紀》：「九月，初與郡守為銅虎符、竹使符。」應劭曰：「銅虎符第一至第五，國家當發兵遣使者，至郡合符，符合乃聽受之。」

　　《馬王堆．老子甲本卷後古佚書》「符」字之「寸」的一劃置於上面，與「寸」字帛書異體同，參見「寸」。
humanum_short_description: 「符」字最早見於戰國金文，從竹付聲，是古代朝廷任官命使、調兵遣將的憑證，也稱兵符。

「 符 」字最早見於戰國金文，從竹付聲，是古代朝廷任官命使、調兵遣將的憑證，也稱兵符。 「 符 」一般分為兩半，右半在帝王，左半在將軍，調兵之時，使者帶符上朝驗合，才可行動。「 符 」形狀多種，以虎符為主；質料有銅、木、玉等，以青銅為多。 《說文》：「符，信也。漢制以竹，長六寸，分而相合。从竹付聲。」 「 符 」又是出入門關的憑證。《玉篇》：「符，符節也。分爲兩邊，各持一以爲信。」《周禮》：「門關用符節。」一般而言，「 符 」多指兵符，「 節 」指通行證；不過「 符 」、「 節 」同為信物，義同可通，出土虎符亦有自名為「 節 」者，參見「 節 」。 金文用作本義，表示兵符。如杜虎符：「兵甲之符，右才(在)君，左才(在)杜。」新郪虎符：「甲兵之符，右才(在)王，左才(在)新郪。」《漢書．文帝紀》：「九月，初與郡守為銅虎符、竹使符。」應劭曰：「銅虎符第一至第五，國家當發兵遣使者，至郡合符，符合乃聽受之。」 《馬王堆．老子甲本卷後古佚書》「 符 」字之「 寸 」的一劃置於上面，與「 寸 」字帛書異體同，參見「 寸 」。
The character" Fu" was first seen in the bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period, from the bamboo to the sound. It was the voucher used by the ancient imperial court to appoint officials, dispatch troops and dispatch generals. " Talisman" is generally divided into two halves, the right half is for the emperor, and the left half is for the general. When the troops are deployed, the messenger will bring the talisman to the court before they can act. " Thu" has many shapes, mainly tiger charm; materials such as copper, wood, jade, etc., mostly bronze. "Shuowen": "Fu, Xinye. The Chinese system is made of bamboo, which is six inches long, and it is divided and matched. The sound is from the bamboo. " Fu" is also the proof of entry and exit. "Yu Pian": "Talisman, Talisman Festival. Divided into two sides, each holding one to believe." "Zhou Li": "Talisman Festival at the gate." Generally speaking, " Fu" refers to soldier symbols, and " Jie" refers to pass ; However, " Fu" and " Jie" are both tokens and have the same meaning. The unearthed tiger symbol also has the name " Jie", see " Jie". Bronze inscriptions are used as the original meaning to represent soldiers. For example, Du Hu Fu: "The Talisman of Armament Armament, the right only (in) Jun, and the Left Only (in) Du." "Han Shu. "Wen Emperor Ji": "In the early September, it is a bronze tiger charm and a bamboo messenger charm with the county guard." Ying Shao said: "Bronze tiger charms are the first to fifth. ." "Mawangdui. After the first volume of Lao Tzu's book, the " inch" line of the word " Fu" is placed on the top, which is the same as the word " inch" in silk script, see " inch".

符字的基本解释

符
fú
古代朝廷传达命令或征调兵将用的凭证：虎符。符信。符节。
代表事物的标记、记号：符号。音符。
相合：符合。言行相符。
道士画的驱使鬼神的图形或线条：符咒。护身符。
古代称祥瑞的征兆：符瑞。符应（y宯g ）（指天降“符瑞”，与人事相应）。
姓。

符字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fú］
［《廣韻》防無切，平虞，奉。］
(1)古代凭证符券、符节、符传等信物的总称。
(2)票证；单据。
(3)盖有官府印信的下行公文的一种。
(4)指拘票。
(5)谓向下属发出命令或通知。
(6)符合；相同。
(7)征兆。
(8)特指帝王受命的征兆。
(9)应验；效验。
(10)一种预言未来的神秘文书。
(11)符书；符箓。
(12)法度；法则。
(13)指效法。
(14)作物的横行。
(15)确实。
(16)表面的，外露的。参见“符采”。
(17)符号。
(18)通“孚”。参见“符甲”。
(19)通“苻”。草名。
(20)通“柎”。草木子房。
(21)姓。

符字的英文翻译

◎ 符
accord with, symbol

符字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　符； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页880第18
【廣韻】防無切【集韻】馮無切【正韻】逢夫切，?音扶。【說文】符，信也。漢制以竹，長六寸，分而相合。【釋名】符，付也。書所敕命于上，付使傳行之也。【玉篇】符，符節也。分爲兩邊，各持一以爲信。【篇海】符者，輔也，所以輔信。又驗也，證也，合也。【六書音義】符之爲言扶也，兩相符合而不差也。【周禮·地官】門關用符節。【註】符節者，如今諸官詔符也。【史記·五帝紀】黃帝合符釜山。【註】合諸侯符契圭璋而朝于釜山。【高祖紀】六年，剖符行封。【孝文紀】初與郡國守相爲銅虎符、竹使符。【註】張晏曰：符以代古之圭璋，从?易也。師古曰：竹使符，與郡守各分其半，右留京師，左以與之。　又符瑞。【禮·記註】萬物之符長。【疏】符謂甘露、醴泉之屬。　又符籙。【帝王世紀】黃帝討蚩尤，西王母以符授之，乃立請祈之壇，親自受符。　又木膚也。【山海經】丹木赤符而黑理。　又書名。【黃帝泰階六符經】【隂符經】【春秋·感精符】。　又官名。【前漢·趙堯傳】堯爲符璽御史。　又姓。【廣韻】魯頃公之孫雅仕，

符字的源字形

符字的起名意思

：本义指朝廷传达命令或调兵遣将的凭证。后引申为记号，标志，相合，一致等。

symbol
Basic explanation of words
symbol
fú
The voucher used by the ancient imperial court to convey orders or recruit soldiers: tiger charm. Fu Xin. Symbol section.
Signs and signs representing things: symbols. Note.
Consistent: Consistent. Match words and deeds.
Figures or lines drawn by Taoist priests to drive ghosts and gods: spells. amulet.
The sign of auspiciousness in ancient times: Fu Rui. Fu Ying (y宯g) (refers to "Fu Rui" from the sky, corresponding to personnel).
name.
symbol
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［fú］
["Guangyun" Fang Wuqi, Pingyu, Feng. ]
(1) The general name of ancient voucher tokens, tokens, festivals, and legends.
(2) Tickets; documents.
(3) A type of downward official document with official seal.
(4) Refers to warrants.
(5) It means that orders or notices are issued to subordinates.
(6) Meet; the same.
(7) Signs.
(8) Especially referring to the sign of the emperor's order.
(9) Fulfilled; validated.
(10) A mysterious document that predicts the future.
(11) Fu Shu; Fu Lu.
(12) Laws; Laws.
(13) Refers to imitating.
(14) The rampage of crops.
(15) Indeed.
(16) Surface, exposed. See "Fu Cai".
(17) Symbol.
(18) Link "Fu". See "Fu Jia".
(19) Through "Fu". Cursive name.
(20) Through "柎". Vegetation ovary.
(21) Last name.
symbol
English translation of words
◎ symbol
accord with, symbol
symbol

Name meaning
: The original meaning refers to the credential of the imperial court to transmit orders or dispatch troops. It is later extended as sign, sign, conformity, conformity, etc.
会意字。从竹,表示符是用竹等制成的调兵遣将的凭证;从付,表示符需交付对方验证,以取得信任;付(f血)兼表声。
本义是古代传达命令或调动军队用的凭证。

fú
I сущ.
1) верительная бирка (из двух половинок для сличения); удостоверение
兵符 военные полномочия (бирка)
符书 верительное письмо (грамота)
2) амулет, талисман; даос. магические начертания (формулы); письменное заклинание
划了一张符 начертать магические знаки
3) условный знак
音符 муз. нота
符记 обозначение условными знаками, условная формула
4) уст. пророчество; письменное предсказание (также лит. жанр)
5) уст. кора (дерева); кожица, оболочка (зерна)
赤符 красноватая кора
II гл.
совпадать; соответствовать
说话前后不符 в своей речи не сводить концы с концами
III собств.
Фу (фамилия)
Radicals: 竹, 付  (bamboo, attach)
Meaning Mnemonic
You take some bamboo and attach it together into a token of appreciation for your friend. Your friend greatly appreciates this token of friendship.
Imagine trying to attach some bamboo together into a token for someone.
Reading Mnemonic
You hand over the token but your friend drops it and yells, "You fool (ふ)! I'm allergic to bamboo!"
Imagine the embarrassment you feel, forgetting they were allergic to bamboo. Oh well, it’s the thought that counts. You’re still a fool, though.
